meanings.definition: Having or bearing a pedicel or peduncle.
meanings.sent1: The pediculate flower swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The pediculate plant stood tall in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The pediculate petals danced as if they had a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, pediculate and flowing, cascaded down her back.
meanings.sent5: The pediculate leaves shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.sent1: The pediculate fruit hung low on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The pediculate branches reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The pediculate stem seemed to have a personality of its own, bending and swaying.
meanings.sent4: The pediculate vine twisted and turned, seeking support.
meanings.sent5: The pediculate trunk of the tree provided a sturdy foundation for the nest.
